meanings.definition: A group of birds or sheep
meanings.sent1: The colorful flock of birds flew across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd counted his flock of sheep before sunset.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to join the flock of birds but failed.
meanings.sent4: The field was a sea of white as the sheep flock grazed peacefully.
meanings.sent5: The flock of birds created a mesmerizing pattern in the sky.

meanings.definition: To gather or move in a crowd or group
meanings.sent1: People flock to the park on sunny weekends.
meanings.sent2: Tourists flock to the beach during the summer months.
meanings.sent3: The children flock around the ice cream truck when it arrives.
meanings.sent4: Supporters flock to the stadium to cheer for their favorite team.
meanings.sent5: Customers flock to the store for the big sale event.
